intro: Peckia nitida, commonly known as the slender peckia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its slender stems and small, daisy-like flowers make it a distinctive addition to gardens. Peckia nitida is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
